Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: These results not only demonstrate that thienyl-substituted anthracene is a very promising building block as an electron - donating unit of low band - gap polymers for high performance PSCs but also PTATDPP can be used as a universal electron donor material compatible with various electron acceptor materials in PSCs.

Let's think step by step.

Material Name
------------

1. thienyl-substituted anthracene
2. PTATDPP (assuming this is a specific material, if not then it should be removed)

Paragraph: These results not only demonstrate that thienyl-substituted anthracene is a very promising building block as an electron - donating unit of low band - gap polymers for high performance PSCs but also PTATDPP can be used as a universal electron donor material compatible with various electron acceptor materials in PSCs.

Let's think step by step.

| --- |
| thienyl-substituted anthracene |
| low band-gap |
| high performance PSCs |
| PTATDPP |
| universal electron donor material |
| various electron acceptor materials |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| high performance |
| universal electron donor material |

Note: I have removed the entities that do not clearly refer to material properties. "Thienyl-substituted anthracene" and "PTATDPP" are specific materials, but they are not material properties. "High performance" and "universal electron donor material" are material properties.
